name: inexpediency
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of not being helpful or useful in a particular situation: We agreed about the inexpediency of following the standard procedure on this occasion. Eventually, the policy was abandoned on the grounds of political inexpediency.
More examplesFewer examplesI was concerned about the inexpediency of allowing a small number of individuals to control so much land.He argued that the law itself was fair, despite the inexpediency of applying it in this case.They wanted to minimize inexpediency in the way the business operated.
